intro: Lachenalia haarlemensis, commonly known as the Haarlem lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, narrow leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of white and yellow. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils. Lachenalia haarlemensis is typically grown in full sun and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
